{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child has a bilirubin level of 4 mg, which is within the normal range. Conjugated bilirubin and alkaline phosphatase are normal, indicating that there is no obstruction in the biliary system. The absence of bile salts and bile in urine also suggests that there is no obstruction. However, the presence of raised urobilinogen in urine indicates increased breakdown of bilirubin. This is commonly seen in hemolytic jaundice, where there is increased destruction of red blood cells. Therefore, the likely diagnosis in this case is D. Hemolytic jaundice.", "answer_choice": "D"}
